titleStmt.title: John Quincy Adams Diary Digital Project

div.p: 1. VI.30. Friday— H.R.U.S.— Reading of Hiland Halls Report on Virginia commutation claims the first hour. Repeated attempts to suspend the reading fail— Wise insists— Second whole hour absorbed—at 11. Comee. of the whole on the State of the Union Report and Bill of the Committee of Foreign Affairs on the North-eastern Boundary Quarrel— Howard— Robertson makes and withdraws an amendment— Long Speech against the Bill by R Biddle— Howard answers— Evans replies— Recess Letters to W. L. Marcy and W. Page— Evans resumes.

2. VI:15. Saturday— General Wool, Ride with Campbell, and the children to the capitol. H.R.U.S.— Reports of Comee. I reported from the Comee. of Manufactures on the Memorial of C. L. Fleischmann, concerning beet-sugar, and on the Letter of W. C. Dawson to B. F. Howard for a repeal of the duty on Cotton, and the Memorial of the Sail makers for a duty on ready made sails— Reports and documents to lay on the table

3. VII. Sunday.— H.R.U.S— Disagreement between the two houses on the proviso to the appropriation for printing the biennial register, by contract to the lowest bidder— Bond moves to adhere— Rives to recede which takes precedence, rejected by yeas and nays 90 to 80. Bond modifies to insist—carried— Senate assist again and ask a conference— Civil and diplomatic. appropriation Bill— Comee. of the whole on the Union Briggs in the chair— Lincoln concludes his Speech on the item of 172000. for the Massachusetts claim—amendment of Senate non-concurred in Comee of the whole— Recess— Letter to Charles— Masstts. claim rejected 83 to 63.

list.head: Peter Valentine’s Decn for a Pension.

div.p: 5. VI. Tuesday.— Mrs Tudor— Robert Gardner’s Letter to her— Evans’s power— I thought an injunction her only remedy— Visit from Mr Beschke— Gave him Dearborn’s Letters and W. S. Campbell’s pamphlet. At the Bank of Washington— At the Intelligencer. Saw Gales and Seaton— Southard came in. Scene in Senate on the Resolution to distribute the Madison Papers— P.U.S. called up from bed Monday Morn. I. H. Adams and Campbell dined with us— Going to-morrow— Greenough here this Evening— Languishing idleness Assorting papers. [symbols]
6. IV:45. Wednesday— I. H. Adams departed— Gallaudet took back fac-simile of Washington’s accounts— Hodgson here— Smithsonian bequest papers
William Huntley’s pension claim from Lewis and Pierce Call at the Pension Office. H. Johnson there.— Call at Mr T. B. Johnson’s— To defer drawing 516 till after the 10th—

10. IV. Sunday— Presbyterian Church. Stranger Card and Pencil contribution for Tract Society. Daniel 12. 4. P.M. St. John’s Church with the children. Mr Hawley. 4th. Sunday in Lent— John 15.4. My wife, Mrs Smith and Mary spent the Evening at Mr T. B. Johnson’s— Mr John Pope here going to-morrow for Kentuckey— Severe Catarrh

11. III:30. Monday— Second almost sleepless Night— Distressing cough— Wilcox here. Conversation with him about Slavery an abolition Walk— Call at National Intelligencer Office— Neither Gales nor Seaton there. Walk over the Bridge beyond the Tyber— Seidlitz power— John Jones, Mulatto Lutheran preacher at Philadelphia— Contribution for the Church— Oppressed Lungs—dejection
